The rest of your accustaions are simply your own. I respect you can have a POV.
I'd like to work with you on the kids' issues, not your personal agenda if you may.

and then worked with Lilian on an exit plan. And that is where you plan to stay. That's an issue.

shrooms, to triangulating with every therapist, to agreeing to Pareto plans, to the TRO, to who you disparaging me to. That list goes on and on.
Now you are going back to the place where that all that started. Your amazing family. Where no biological fathers are permitted to see the children
they fathered with you. Kwans take kids from their fathers 100% of the time. It’s pretty messed up.
I wish you well, also.

Message 3560 of 4024
Christine-
Adrian met with Kari yesterday, and we received an excellent report card. During their conversation, they decided I would attend the next
appointment to address some things on Adrian's mind. This is a significant breakthrough, as it's the first time he has agreed to have me join his session
in all the months he has been going.
I am excited about this opportunity, especially considering our near-total estrangement and the upcoming trip to Hong Kong, where all of these
issues began after Elsa and your Mother's advice. The timing is perfect for a breakthrough, especially given the professional advice that there might be
better ideas than the Hong Kong trip.
I wanted to let you know that I was looking forward to a professionally facilitated discussion. However, you intervened and stopped it. You listed
many reasons against it and stated that Adrian voted against attendance because that would mean two full hours in a single week and you two felt like
that was too much to invest.
My Concerns:
- I think you should have talked with me instead of letting Adrian vote on therapy without discussing it.
- As the targeting parent, your influence in this discussion with him may affect his decision to talk to me.
- You are making 100% of the mental health decisions for our family without any legal authority to do so.
- This is not what the books Jennifer recommended say to do. We need to heed the advice we were given.
Reflection:
During my first reunification meeting, you told Adrian that I had not blown, implying I was under the influence, which is medically impossible as I
am on Vivitrol. Despite knowing this, you and Natalie demanded I take two 12-panel tests.
This is akin to giving Max a pregnancy test after a date – unnecessary and misleading. This demonstrates either a total lack of understanding of my
sobriety program (big issue) or nefarious intentions. (bigger issue.) by you two.
Either way, your actions misled Adrian, and you both used him as a pawn, especially troubling given Kari's concern that he was considering self-harm
because he was caught in the middle when we started with her. He thinks this was him.
Recap:
- First reunification session: Adrian was misled and used as a pawn.
- First requested Father/Son session: You unilaterally canceled it.
Moving forward, I hope that any decisions regarding our children's mental health (or any other significant decisions) will involve me.
Additionally, I ask that we collectively make an effort to:
- Start being honest with Adrian
- Stop defaming me as his father
- Avoid using Adrian as your pawn
I remain optimistic because you were always a great mom before July. Even in December, when we had the Phase I parenting plan, things were good,
and we worked well together.

- Stop interfering with the mental health engagements run by professionals
Sent:07/11/2024 at 11:42 AM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 07/11/2024 at 12:42 PM)
Subject:Therapy and Decision Making

- Do not assert sole decision-making for the kid in the absence of legal orders
robert

That is crazy making. Please stop that kind of communication. It is counterproductive.
